TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class WindowContentFrameStats : Android.Views.FrameStats, Android.OS.IParcelable, IDisposable

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WindowContentFrameStats extends Android.Views.FrameStats implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: This class contains window content frame statistics.

remarks.para: This class contains window content frame statistics. For example, a window content is rendred in frames when a view is scrolled. The frame statistics are a snapshot for the time interval from to .

The key idea is that in order to provide a smooth user experience an application has to draw a frame at a specific time interval obtained by calling . If the application does not render a frame every refresh period the user will see irregular UI transitions.

An application posts a frame for presentation by synchronously rendering its contents in a buffer which is then posted or posting a buffer to which the application is asychronously rendering the content via GL. After the frame is posted and rendered (potentially asynchronosly) it is presented to the user. The time a frame was posted can be obtained via , the time a frame content was rendered and ready for dsiplay (GL case) via , and the time a frame was presented on the screen via .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int64 GetFramePostedTimeNano(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.summary: Get the time a frame at a given index was posted by the producer (e.g. the application).

remarks.para: Get the time a frame at a given index was posted by the producer (e.g. the application). It is either explicitly set or defaulted to the time when the render buffer was posted.
Note: A frame can be posted and still it contents being rendered asynchronously in GL. To get the time the frame content was completely rendered and ready to display call .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int64 GetFrameReadyTimeNano(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.summary: Get the time a frame at a given index was ready for presentation.

remarks.para: Get the time a frame at a given index was ready for presentation.
Note: A frame can be posted and still it contents being rendered asynchronously in GL. In such a case this is the time when the frame contents were completely rendered.

Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
